p: The conventional bronchodilators used in asthma include Î²2 agonist, anticholinergics and PDE inhibitors are well known for their cardiac stimulation which is a serious side effect ( Undem, 2006). However, it is possible that the presence of combination of Ca ++ channel blockers with anticholinergics and PDE inhibitory like agents, as determined in the essential oil of T. serrulatus, are likely to offset the cardiac stimulation usually associated with these bronchodilators, particularly when given orally.
